## Pitch/Hook
### Slogan: Ewa's Future is Oahu's Future

In the battle 
A third of all vacant prime land for development on Oahu is located on the Ewa Plain. The current west end of the rail line is in Ewa. Ewa's rich farmland provides food 

## About/Trey's Story
Trey learned the importance of public service at an early age from his parents, an Army officer and a teacher. He has 4 younger siblings

- military brat
- husband/parent
- civic technologist

## Issues/Priorities
### Smart Growth
As a trained urban planner and experienced [local housing advocate](https://www.civilbeat.org/2022/06/this-group-is-trying-to-make-sense-of-hawaiis-regulatory-landscape/), I know that continuing to pave over Ewa's prime agricultural land is not the right solution to Hawaii's housing affordability crisis. I will advocate for dense, mixed-use development in town and along the rail line to house more people while minimizing the impact on traffic and the environment.

### Homelessness
[Research has shown](https://www.sightline.org/2022/03/16/homelessness-is-a-housing-problem/) that homelessness is primarily a problem of housing supply and affordability.

### Economic Development
Ewa needs more jobs. Instead of forcing ourselves and our neighbors to sit on the H-1 for hours every day, we should be creating high-paying opportunities in our own community. As a former small business owner and economic development researcher, I look forward to working with local businesses to grow and expand.

## How to Vote
Voting begins **April 28** and ends **May 19**.  

In Neighborhood Board elections, **voting is online-only at this website**: [https://web1.hnl.info/nbe/starter](https://web1.hnl.info/nbe/starter). Registered voters will receive a passcode in the mail.  

For more information, visit the official [Election FAQs](https://www.honolulu.gov/cms-nco-menu/site-nco-sitearticles/18327-election-faqs.html).

[**Am I in Ewa 23? Check this Map.**](https://www.honolulu.gov/rep/site/nco/maps/23_Ewa.jpg)
